reviewTitle: Good causal mouse, but somewhat finicky connectivity
reviewDescription: I'm looking for four things in a mouse these days.  I'm looking for something that connects without needing a plug-in, I'm looking for something that's rechargeable without needing insertable batteries, and I'm looking for something that feels good, and I'm looking for something that works like a mouse should work.This mouse is stellar in three out of four respects.  I like how it feels, especially as someone with slightly larger hands, this is a mouse that's a pretty ideal size and it's comfortable to use.  The buttons and motions are responsive, as they should be.  And the battery life is great, this can go weeks without needing a recharge even if you leave it on.The thing that keeps this from being 5 stars are some issues with connectivity.  During regular use, there will be brief periods where the mouse stops responding.  This typically lasts only a couple seconds, after which it returns to functioning as normal.  However, there have been two instances where the Bluetooth connection has stopped functioning for longer periods.  It still works when you use it in the mode that connects with the dongle, but it won't pair with either Bluetooth mode for a while.  I'm not sure what the issue is, but it would be a pretty significant problem if I didn't have the ability to use the other mode - and given that the dongle is USB-A, newer laptops with USB-C without an adaptor may run into this.These problems are not so bad for me that they ruin the product completely.  For causal everyday use, the slightly finicky behavior isn't really a big deal.  But for people who absolutely need something that doesn't cut out on them, they may want to look elsewhere.

reviewTitle: A fine mouse (just not for me) with shady return policies
reviewDescription: This is a fine mouse on paper. The buttons and scroll wheel work well, I haven't had any issues with tracking, and the rechargeable battery is nice (especially for the price). But after a week of using it, there have been enough small annoyances that I decided to return it.First, if you're interested in the quiet clicking that this mouse advertises, just know that it is only the two main buttons that are quiet. The middle click and side buttons are exceptionally loud (louder than any mouse I have ever used before). There's no side scrolling on the scroll wheel and it also has no fast scrolling option, both of which I didn't realize how much I would miss from my previous mouse. The shape is also too flat to be truly ergonomic in my opinion, although the buttons are all placed nicely.The biggest annoyance for me though has been the battery. While the concept of a rechargeable battery sounds nice, the mouse goes too far in efforts to save its battery. It turns itself off after only a few minutes and can only be woken up by pressing a button. You can't just jiggle it like I have done for past mice, and since there is no indication whether it is on or not, I frequently go to move the mouse after reading or typing for a few minutes and don't know whether I have to click the mouse to wake it up. TThese annoyances mounted up enough for me to decide to just return the mouse, but then I found out that the seller listed this product as containing "flammable liquids or gases" so it was not eligible for return. This is a total lie since other rechargeable wireless mice do not have this designation, and I had to go through Amazon support to get the mouse refunded. I also asked them to change the designation of the mouse so others don't have this problem in the future.Overall, I could see someone else enjoying this mouse and not being as annoyed with its quirks as I am, so I was originally planning on leaving a relatively positive review, but after the shady return process, I can't recommend it anymore.

reviewTitle: One of the best budget mice I've ever tried
reviewDescription: By just about every metric you would use to define a mouse by, this one checks off just about every box. - Ergonomic/comfort - check - it has a sweet spot for size and comfort that rivals more expensive mice. For under $20 US with coupon, you cannot beat this deal.

reviewTitle: Purchased this as a Secondary Mouse but It's Now my Primary
reviewDescription: This has been an excellent mouse in just about every measure. I was in need of a secondary mouse for around the house and for a backup to my (at the time) main mouse in case of battery running out. Since it was going to be a secondary mouse I wasn't super picky about looks or ergonomics, etc. But I did have 4 criteria -1) Must be Bluetooth (no dongles! unless its an extra feature)2) Must be rechargeable (My old main mouse is rechargeable, it's liberating not dealing with AA or AAA, remembering which type is needed and/or how many - I will never go back lol)3) Standard/full sized (small mice are fine for small hands which mine are not)4) Finally, low cost.I did a search and this one caught my eye. I had never heard of the brand but it checked off all 4 of those criteria nicely so I went ahead and purchased. If it turned out to be not-so-great for whatever reason then NBD since its intended as a secondary/back-up.When I received it I was surprised because it "felt" like a more premium (aka more expensive) mouse. Had a good weight (not too much or little). It was solid and well built feeling (no loose or misaligned bits). Ergonomics were nice feeling in my hand too. It is indeed a silent clicker as advertised but it still maintains a satisfying click "feel" when pressing the L/R buttons (not mushy). The scroll wheel is wide and smooth-rolling (not just a thin rubber disk with a bumpy roll that is common at this price point).My only negative comments are extremely minor and would not have affected my decision to purchase and don't add up to any whole star deductions (maybe 1/2 star deduction if all added up). The L/R main buttons each come to a point in the front of the mouse. This seems to be cosmetic and doesn't serve a purpose but it does sometimes snag (clothing, blankets, etc.) when used off of the desk. The USB dongle (optional if you need it) is simply stuck into a slot on the underside and not covered or secured very well. Of course I immediately lost mine. Only the L/R buttons are silent, the side buttons definitely are not. For some odd reason the charging cable connection is micro-USB (Cost reasons maybe? It came with a cord so it's not really an issue anyway).Even with those minor criticisms this mouse quickly became my favorite to use due to the points I mentioned above. My main (and far more expensive, yet less premium or well-built feeling in comparison) mouse was demoted to secondary status and I've been using this one ever since (since last August, about 7 months now).Also of note: I think I've only had to recharge it once so far.It's price has increased by $1 (factoring in current 15% coupon offered) which would not change my opinion.

reviewTitle: Great mouse for a great price
reviewDescription: I had bought a few mouses recently, but found myself disappointed in all of them. I have a background in human factors psychology & work on a product team, so I tend to be annoyed with mediocre design. Recently I bought a Logitech M705, which I really enjoy. However, I also had need for a bluetooth mouse & wanted something at least comparable (i.e. nice weight, ergonomics/usability, grip/material, battery life, smooth skates etc.) to the m705, all while remaining less expensive (expensive mouses just seem silly to me - the only caveat being vocational use & hardcore gaming (risk for carpel tunnel)). I'm pleased to say that after a week of use, this is my favorite mouse of the 8 I have laying around.Admirable Qualities:The L & R buttons are quite silent & after experiencing this I've begun to question how I ever endured so much loud clicking. The material feels rubberized (I got the black version) & high quality. The bluetooth (5) connects in about a second & is easily found (I read some comment about how the BT button sticks out too far? - absolute nonsense). I love how the ergonomics keep my pinky from dragging around on mouse-pads (most mouse-pads being somewhat gross) & the size is no more/less than it needs to be to let my fingers sprawl out in a comfortable manner (I have mid-size hands - if you've got Hagrid hands this may not be for you).Could use work:The scroll wheel is a little bit slow on MacOS in comparison to other mouses I've owned (even with scroll settings maxed).The buttons, outside of the left & right, are more noisy than most mouse buttons which is a bad contrast.The skates have already picked up a bunch of dirt/dust & I use a hard mouse-pad.The weight is very light, although many mouse's "weight" comes from batteries, which I personally don't like (makes it feel cheaper).It charges using micro USB which seems a bit dated - wish they would have used AA/AAA batteries to power this mouse (modern mouses getting a year+ off a single battery just warms my heart).I can't speak on the battery life, however it hasn't needed any additional charging for this past week.It's disappointing that the RGB is only active during charge (although I understand & accept why). I wish the gray would have been the same material as this black (would have matched my M1), however looking at that shiny/cheap looking plastic space gray makes me realize I made the right choice.Overall:I was a bit apprehensive before buying this & even in the first few minutes I had doubts. However, I am now skeptical that you're going to find any mouse in this price-range, or above it, that will have comparable efficacy, composition & well planned design.

reviewTitle: sleep mode destroys all other good qualities
reviewDescription: Every one of the other good qualities of this mouse are overcome by the annoying sleep feature.  If it was battery powered, a sleep mode would be very beneficial, BUT IT'S RECHARGEABLE FOR CRYING OUT LOUD.  The period to time out means that you can't even read a long article before you must pick it up and do an off-on switch sequence.  Some may want this brief-span feature but some, I'd bet many, don't want it in a rechargeable mouse. I can find no assistance on this subject on the woefully lacking instruction card or the company website.  It inexpensive but save your money.

reviewTitle: I liked this mouse....till it died after 6 months
reviewDescription: This WAS a pretty decent mouse, especially for the price.  I liked it.  At first I had connection issues.  It would keep needing to be reconnected which was annoying.  I probably should have taken this as a sign there was something amiss and returned it for replacement but I did not.Today, only 6 months old it has stopped working.  It keeps disconnecting and the cursor just sits there until I turn the mouse upside down and hit the connection button until the 2.4Ghz light comes on then it works.....for approximately 5 seconds.  I move the mouse to a new place on the desktop and all of a sudden it stops responding again.I have been charging this mouse all morning as I thought it was the battery but when I plug it in the mousewheel blinks in red.  I don't know what that means but the mouse is not working.In the product description it says it has a one year warranty but I don't want to spend $8 shipping on a $15 mouse to return it to the manufacturer.Buy at your own risk, it's a really decent mouse for the money but you may be buying another one to replace it when it stops working.  The wireless mouse I took from my other computer has been working for 7 years.....but it is a Microsoft.

This product stopped charging and no option for a battery so is a lost. Don’t recommend

This little guy gets the job done for a low price.  Two things to note:  If you're right-handed, the right-hand side of the unit has an extra ridge/protrusion that most mice lack.  I suppose this is meant to be ergonomic somehow, but it feels odd.  Your ring finger rests on it, slightly elevated from what it normally would be.  Not a deal killer but odd.  The other is a battery saving feature (I assume), which is that after a few minutes of inactivity, you have to wake up the mouse by clicking one of the two keys; merely wiggling it back and forth does nothing.  But its clicks are quiet, as advertised.

The two main buttons are completely silent, and the wheel is silent when being rolled. The wheel does make a louder than desired click when used as a button, but since I'm not doing that all the time it's fine as it is. The mouse is very light, which may make it feel cheap to some, but I've found in using it 8 - 10 hours a day the lightness helps it remain comfortable to use. My only complaint would be the extreme sensitivity of the two side buttons makes it very easy to accidentally click one of them. I've gotten used to that and no longer hit them inadvertently, but it filled the first day or two with this mouse with a lot of accidental back button clicks in my browser.Besides being quiet and light, I like being able to pair it with multiple machines and switch easily. The button being on the bottom of the mouse doesn't bother me. Maybe if I were switching every few minutes it would get annoying, but I only use the feature a few times a day.

reviewTitle: Nice features, decent execution and price
reviewDescription: Ergonomic it definitely is. I’ve used this mouse in about 3 different ways since I got it - Bluetooth on my Mac and PC, and using the USB receiver on my PC. Here’s what I like: With the USB connection the mouse is pretty responsive and takes about 1 or 2 seconds to wake up. The mouse connected effortlessly with both PC and Mac, no software required, using the different connection options,  and that’s it’s fully rechargeable. You can switch the resolution to improve tracking and focus. It’s pretty inexpensive for a device with these features.I have a USB-C laptop and hate using the dongles so I wanted to try a bluetooth mouse. The reviews were decent so I thought, “why not!”  Here’s why: I don’t like the sluggishness and latency when using the bluetooth connection, I had to click buttons twice before it recognized the input, I’d drag the mouse and literally wait 2 or 3 seconds for the cursor to follow. It goes to sleep really quickly and seems to be a hard sleeper. I’d wait sometimes upwards of 20 seconds for the cursor to move after leaving the mouse idle for about 2 minutes.on a few occasions I thought the connection was severed and tried to re-pair the mouse with my laptop. Overall it’s a great device, if you’re not solely dependent on the bluetooth connectivity and well worth the price of admission.

reviewTitle: A great mouse, so far--10/1/22 update, dropped a star
reviewDescription: 10/1/22 Update: The click button has stopped working.  It was fun while it lasted. I would say I gave this mouse moderate usage, so I am a bit disappointed it has quit on me already.  I am dropping it down to 4 stars unless the company responds to my email I sent a few days ago and offers a solution.  4 stars because the battery does have solid life and it is easy and quick to recharge and when the clicker button was working it was very quiet.  Dropped a star for the lack of durability.After using this mouse all day for a couple days now, I really like this mouse. For the price, this is the best mouse I have ever had and I have used quite a few mice from all brands. The quiet click is the bomb! Love it. The click button has a super solid feel and the mouse is very responsive.  Scroll wheel works great. My only slight complaint is the buttons on the side (the back button) and they feel soft/spongy and I wouldn't mind them being a bit tighter. The click is a louder than the top button, but is the same loudness as any other "normal" mouse I have used.  I wouldn't hesitate to buy this again assuming it holds up over time.

reviewTitle: questionable quality, but possibly best in class
reviewDescription: I believe this is the only rechargeable bluetooth 5.0 mouse with a traditional shape I could find on Amazon. I wouldn't mind trying a newer design, but not one of the common flat designs (i tried one that was sort of flat, and fail to see the advantage), and certainly not with a slippery scroll wheel. One very important note for me is that this wheel material feels like rubber, so it's very grippy and moves effortlessly without any pressure required. The wheel is illuminated blue when charging (which it hasn't really required yet)The mouse is lightweight plastic and doesn't feel premium, true, but I'm fine with that.I haven't had any problems with accidentally clicking the infamous side buttons.Bluetooth 5.0 connected very rapidly...when I first tried. All has been fine with tracking (I'm not a designer or gamer), although on at least one occasion after returning from sleep, there was stuttering when moving cursor across screen. I'll be watching closely to see if this reoccurs.The other concern for me right now is this strange phenomena: I had to remove the mouse and all bluetooth devices from my computer.  When I tried to add it again later, I again used the mouse button that switches between BT 3.0, BT 5.0, and usb until I was on the BT 5.0 setting. However, this time, the computer saw the BT3.0 setting as a BT 5.0 mouse, and vise-versa. It seems to connect and work ok, but...??Another feature I wanted that is uncommon is linux support, and although I haven't tried yet, there is at least a "mention" in the supplied images. If it does in fact work in linux (and continues to function), highly recommended for twenty bucks.

I was able to connect it via Bluetooth but it would turn off in the middle of use even if I kept the mouse moving and it had a full charge. The light would blink underneath and the mouse would no longer have any reaction to motion or clicks.. so I'd have to remove the device and connect it again through Bluetooth in order for it to work for 30secs to a minute and cut out on me again. After many tries and researching how to resolve this.. I just plugged it into the laptop using the USB stick it comes with. I was trying use Bluetooth to conserve the USB ports slots. It works fine with the USB stick plugged in.

When you click the scroller it does click but that doesn't bother me. 10/10 recommend charges fast and is my forever mouse.

I love the feature I discovered while using it a week in by accident- on the left side of the mouse there are two thin linear buttons. When you use your thumb and click the lower button it takes you back to the previous page or area you were on previously. When working in patient charts this is a great extra feature for going back… love that!!! I’ve charged it a few times now. The charge lasts a very long time… I charge it over night and it’s good for a very long time after the charge. For the price it’s wonderful.
The mouse setup with just a few pushes of a button. Nice feel and texture. It is big so if you have small hands you may have a reach a your finger tips.

Battery life appears to be great, mouse is super silent when clicking. reviewTitle: Good mouse with significant compromises in quality
reviewDescription: This mouse is great value for the price. However, after a few months of M-F use it has started to show problems. Mainly, the battery drains quickly and the scroll wheel is malfunctioning.Although this mouse has very aggressive energy saving features, I find myself having to charge it every few days of regular use, which is regrettable because I don’t want wires all over my desk.The scroll wheel is also very important for my type of work. However, in just these few months it has begun squeaking and rolling on its own a bit. Otherwise, I do enjoy how silent and ergonomic it is.

reviewTitle: Amazing for Price (UPDATE: Maybe not as good as thought)
reviewDescription: This mouse feels fantastic to use. It's very smooth and seems to have very good reaction speeds. The primary two buttons are very quiet and smooth to click, and the mouse wheel and side buttons are more firm with a pop. I have not tested this mouse with games. One important thing to note is that the sleep mode stays on until a button on the mouse is pressed. It will not wake up by simply moving it, you have to press a button. I spent roughly 30 seconds waiting for it to wake up before I realized I needed to click. However, it only takes roughly a second to wake up from sleep mode. I have not had battery life issues yet. Overall, a very nice mouse that fits well in the hands.UPDATE: While the majority of what I stated above stands true when this mouse works properly, lately I've been experiencing what can only be described as unresponsiveness from my mouse. It moves very jerkily and sometimes requires multiple clicks to register an action. This happens roughly every few days, and I'm not sure what causes it nor how it is fixed, but it definitely ruins any sort of productivity this mouse provides and often leads to just using my touchpad (which then begs the question, why did I get the mouse?). I've lowered my review from 5 stars to 2. Disappointing and I recommend paying more for a better mouse, as you're only getting what you paid for with this one.

Based on the reviews and the features, I really wanted to like this mouse.  Unfortunately for me I found it to be very uncomfortable to use.  The problem for me was the left click button is on the same plane as the right click, not higher and at a different angle than a lot of other ergonomic mice on the market.  While I didn't think this would be a deal breaker for me, given the afore mentioned reviews, features, and price, after using it for a day I found myself unwittingly toeing the front of the mouse to the left (I'm right handed), which after some thought I realized was because of the poor ergonomics of the button design.  I'm sure that the reason behind this was the ability to allow both right and left-handed users equal opportunity to use this mouse, but appealing to both meant that I found it very uncomfortable to use in a very short period of time.  If not for that issue, which admittedly is a big one, I would've rated this product much higher.

Additionally, it is uncomfortable to use for someone who has medium-large hands. This featherlight mouse is a good example of a mouse you would expect to get for under $20.Besides the attractive look, the only positive thing I have to report is the low noise (not silent) left and right mouse click buttons. However, the benefit of the low noise of those buttons are offset by the noisy loud click of the two thumb buttons.My remarks come from someone who is a tech enthusiast who has a large collection of mice ranging in level from budget to the best money will buy. I bought this mouse because I was looking for a bluetooth mouse that was full-size, comfortable, good bluetooth connectivity, and a smooth glide. This mouse is none of those.Lastly, I question the validity of the three Amazon video positive reviews for this product because my experience was opposite. There are many manufacturers who take advantage of this Amazon policy loophole.I do not recommend this mouse even if you are looking for a budget or backup mouse.Caveat emptor.

In that sense, it's not bad.The issue I found is that the sensitivity is very erratic.  I have a whole-desk mousepad which has a little wear (it's black, some parts are lightening white).  No problem with my other mouse, but this one loses sensitivity randomly over the core part of the pad I use.  If I go over a corner that gets no use and is very dark, its' fine. In fact, I'm getting a new one because I just can't handle the inconsistency for standard work tasks.The sleep function is actually nice and has probably saved me, and I've never had any "accidental off" issues with the bottom switch.Had this for a month or two, already getting a new one. reviewDescription: I absolutely loved this mouse.- Connected immediately to my Dell computer.- No glitches.- No connection problems.- Smooth movement.I only use it to select shows and movies from across the room.Sunday night I had the mouse on my chest… unaware I was ruining my nightgown with a sticky, pine sap-like, liquid leaking from bottom of mouse.Once I realized what was happening, I popped open the left and right clickers (along with the back) and that’s what the pictures show.Update: Must have been glue. I let the mouse dry out a few days then put it back together. After a couple of days I charged it and turned on. Working again. DO NOT use mouse without a mousepad.
Had this mouse for about 2 months, left click already stopped working. Also had a few other mouse from the same brand . But they didn’t last. Should’ve tried other mouse from another brand

reviewTitle: Was pretty good while it lasted
reviewDescription: I got the mouse about three months ago and it worked like a charm until very recently. It feels alright in your hand, and having variable DPI is nice, but the sleep mode can only be quickly deactivated by clicking, and the computer will register that as an intended click, so if your mouse just so happens to be sitting on a link when it goes to sleep and you're not thinking about it when you get back, you might be inconvenienced by that every once in a while. But that's never been the dealbreaker for me.The biggest issue is after three months of very light use (not even using it every day), it is already bugging out a lot of the time. It won't move when I'm moving it or will change the location of the mouse on-screen all over the place, lagging, etc. I've charged it up again to make sure battery wasn't the issue, and it seems to persist. This might be an isolated issue with the one I was sent, though I would recommend picking something else, as using the trackpad currently gives me less frustration than the mouse, defeating the entire purpose.

After two months and three days of purchasing this, the battery charge will not last. I was pleased with it initially, but now I do not like it. I have to charge it every week (one every other day sometimes). It is a shame the return window is closed; otherwise, this would go back.

Quiet and responsive got the mouse 2 stars.The mouse never would connect to my brand new Dell laptop via WiFi.  Laptops have a limited number of USB ports and I didn't want to dedicate one to an input device that should connect via Wifi.The on/off button protrudes just far enough so if you run across the least bump or hiccup, it turns the mouse off.  I'm a petite woman and have small hands.  Still the "Back" that is on the left side just above the thumb rest is so easily pressed, even without the intention of doing so, that I can't tell you how many post or replies or data input fields I have lost to pressing this button by mistake.This mouse sucks.  But it does look stylish.

reviewTitle: You Get What You Pay For
reviewDescription: Bought this mouse for my work from home setup, but should have gone with the more expensive option. The scroll is extremely frustrating, as it does not scroll evenly. It often takes a large scroll for it to sense that the scroll wheel is moving, and then it becomes more sensitive from there. You can not scroll smoothly this way. The movement of the mouse on screen is fairly choppy. I could not get the bluetooth to pair, so I had the USB plugged in to my computer to connect it. Save yourself the headache and spend $20 more for a much better mouse.

reviewTitle: It was a good mouse till it wasn’t.
reviewDescription: The mouse was great but the left clicker no longer works after using it for 2 weeks
Randomly spasms

reviewTitle: Fails at what it claims it does
reviewDescription: While mouse 1 & mouse 0 are fairly silent (not as silent compared to higher quality switches), the mouse has the loudest back and forward buttons I've ever heard on any mouse! The middle wheel button is about as loud as most mouse. As someone who reprograms the purpose of those back/forward buttons for more useful function, I am stuck with what I tried to free myself of - a loud clicking mouse.

reviewTitle: Great mouse; problems with 2019 Macbook Pro & Monterey
reviewDescription: Very good mouse, worked fine with my old iMac.  Upgraded to a 2019 Macbook Pro running Monterey OS 12.0.1, and am having problems with left-clicking.  Very inconsistent.  Sometimes is fine, sometimes you click and then have to move the cursor before it registers, and sometimes it registers as a left click (mainly on the dock icons).  Also, scrolling is no longer consistently linear - sometimes you can scroll a whole lot and not move much, then all of a sudden it "kicks in" and you skip over a bunch.I have emailed customer service but no response thus far.  Am disappointed.This is a five star mouse with a two star compatibility problem...

I use lower sensitivity for mice for better precision, even just doing day to day browsing, but this mouse has trouble keeping up with wider/faster sweeping motions. If I'm only moving it in very tiny increments, then it seems fine, until I want to turn around in a game faster or move my mouse across the screen to click off of an ad. At that point, it then starts feeling like it's tracking through mud at a fixed speed way behind where my actual hand movement is. It's like there's a cutoff for acceleration, and is very noticeable with my preference in sensitivity. I've googled for answers, but nothing explains why this happens, nor fixes my issue.

reviewTitle: Two months in and it just doesn't work anymore.
reviewDescription: I got this in late December 2020, and now in late February 2021 it's dead. It started having what appeared to be connectivity issues earlier this week, and even after uninstalling and reinstalling and changing the connection, if I left it still for more than minute I had to move it around for 5-10 seconds to get it to come back. As of now, it won't come back at all. I even tried connecting it direction to my desktop via USB and that didn't make a difference either, leading me to the assumption that the sleep function is probably to blame here. It's a shame because it fits my hands really well, which is a big deal because I literally have a condition that makes my fingers really long compared to my palms, but I can't buy a new mouse every two months.

I bought this mouse for its price and ergonomic shape, and it's certainly inexpensive and feels good in the hand. It also holds a charge for a solid week and I'm on my computer all day, everyday. However, its bluetooth just doesn't like to stay connected to my M1 Macbook Air. Probably about 5 times per day, it'll spontaneously disconnect. I returned the first mouse and got a second one, and I've also tried it on two different M1 Macbooks, but it's the same result each time. If I use the included wireless USB adapter, I don't have a problem at all, but I specifically bought this mouse to use bluetooth and it's just too frustrating to continue using it. I'm going to need to find something better.

It's a decent mouse when it works. It fits the hand well, though the tracking is a bit slow/lagging and feels inaccurate. But the biggest issue for me is the fact that the battery life is incredibly short. Either that, or it's just poorly designed and keeps bugging out on me.When I purchased this mouse I also purchased a bluetooth wireless keyboard for around the same price. I've only had to charge the keyboard once and it's worked flawless this whole time. I've had to charge the mouse half a dozen times, and it's given me nothing but grief. Just wanted to find a decent bluetooth mouse with side mouse4 and mouse5 buttons that didn't cost $40 like the logitech one, but that might be the only option at this point.

I love the quiet click and responsiveness of the mouse. It works well,BUT I hate the way it feels. It’s slick and I feel like I have no real grip on the mouse. It’s slipped out of my hand just trying to quickly move the mouse to the left. Not a fan due to this.
Pathetic. Won’t charge or connect after two weeks. Hate that I bought more than one.

reviewTitle: Forget about using it with bluetooth
reviewDescription: This mouse is great, but like others have said, that's only when it works.Using the USB dongle, it works great, but I bought it for the bluetooth functionality. [EDIT] The USB dongle is now dead, so after less than 2 years, the mouse is trash... The dongle just came apart, and it was still working but a few weeks later stopped altogether. Even after a new fresh windows install the dongle is dead. Too bad I can't take the one start I gave out.It connects correctly, but when you don't move the mouse for a few seconds it disconnects and the connection can never restore. It is super frustrating. I understand it is a good mouse for the price and I shouldn't expect much, but at least basic functionality from the thing.Do yourself a favor and don't buy this mouse. I will work to your delight for 2 weeks to a month and blow itself up slowly like a rocket deorbiting in the atmosphere.My productivity has been hurt badly since this is something I wanted to use to be productive. To be able to connect to my laptop or my desktop using the same mouse. But my dreams and illusions are all gone.
Left mouse button stopped working properly 4 months after purchase
Mouse was good but did not last.  Bought in September 2023 and stopped working in January 2024.
This thing dies daily.

reviewTitle: Dead in just a few weeks
reviewDescription: My first mouse lasted about a year and then died. I decided it was super cheap and a year was maybe ok for something of this price so I bought another. This second one didn't even last a few weeks. Returning and not buying this brand again.
Worked one time and then stopped. The Bluetooth would not connect to ANY device, and the USB underneath didn't even WORK. This is worthless, DON'T buy.

reviewTitle: The 4.0 is slow and my computer can't even connect to the 5.0?
reviewDescription: Did anyone have this same problem? I ended up plugging in the usb because it's not suitable for gaming... very disappointed. Just unhappy, I want a refund.
Worked great for a few weeks and then the battery completely died and had to buy a new one. Cheap battery.

When I first opened the box I was excited for this mouse. It is bigger than what I’m used to using, but I have long fingers, so it fit comfortably in my hand. However, my experience went downhill from there. I initially hooked this mouse up in Bluetooth 5.0, and wow did it lag. Just to be safe I double checked the specs on my computer – it is Bluetooth 5.1, so that shouldn’t be the issue. To put the problem into prospective, this mouse lagged enough that I struggled to center the mouse on the x button to close a window I had open. Annoyed, but not willing to give up, I tried Bluetooth 3.0 next. At first it worked great, but within 5 minutes the next problem became apparent. When I used this mouse in Bluetooth 3.0 it would track and scroll smoothly and reacted as I expected, but periodically the cursor would randomly jump a quarter of the screen to the left or right. Finally, mainly out of curiosity, I tried using the 2.4G dongle. To its credit, 2.4G worked great for this mouse. But I didn’t buy a Bluetooth mouse to have to leave a dongle plugged into a USB slot. I will definitely be returning this mouse.
Works well

reviewTitle: A basic mouse with basic functions. Works as expected.
reviewDescription: I was expecting more but the mouse is just a basic mouse. I got spoiled using a feature packed Logitech mouse for many years. This one is a good one to have as a backup mouse but not a desired feature rich one to use permanently for me. It looks significant but feels insignificant, it is just basic. A word of warning, this is a "no return" item. Exchange only. Also, aside from a wireless mouse, It is good to keep a wired mouse that plugs into USB to use at any point where you cannot use your wireless mouse for whatever reason. This one works and it is acceptable for the price. In a world of low end products, this one is at the top of that spectrum. I hope this helps.

UPDATE: Bluetooth is janky, losing precision as it stutters. Another review mentioned the same. Turned bt off and now using the USB dongle, no issues yet.Despite this, the mouse is great; larger ergonomic size for comfort and the silence of the left right clickers.  Wanted to keep 5 stars but had to take away one but I'm still keeping this mouse.original reviewPros: left/right buttons and scroll wheel are almost silent. Size of the mouse is larger than most, very comfortable. Bluetooth - no usb dongle. Doesn't go to sleep mode in 5 minutes like most.Cons: middle button is very stiff and not nearly as silent. It's rechargeable - can't replace batteries. The two side buttons are easy to press but also not as silent.Awesome mouse for $20. Very satisfied and the biggest downside is the middle button being hard to press but I'll deal with it. Could have more DPI and the ability to assign customs keys to the buttons (no directions).Using for office work - excel, web, mail, etc. Can't comment on how it functions as a gaming mouse.

reviewTitle: Great mouse overall with a little technical problem
reviewDescription: Update: I recently noticed that the buttons for going back/foward between pages work differently on Mac, but I don't know how to configure it. In Mac, those buttons serve to scroll up and down the page.I like the design and feel of the mouse. The three settings of DPI is thoughtful. I haven't used long enough to test out the battery life, but I did notice an incompatibility with switching the mouse between different computers. I'm not sure if the problem is specific to this mouse or just something common among all. After switching the mouse to connect with another computer (mac to windows; both via bluetooth), I wanted to switch back from windows to mac. The mouse doesn't just automatically connect despite if it's in the "connection/detectable mode" or not. Not only that, the computer doesn't recognize the mouse even if I manually click to connect in the bluetooth setting of my mac. The solution I found was to remove the mouse (memory/configuration?) and reconnect again.

reviewTitle: Not an Apple Magic Mouse, But Darn Good
reviewDescription: I needed a new mouse and didn't want to pay the price for an Apple Magic Mouse, which I do love. This is a fantastic substitute. I'm missing the touch surface and some of the cool gestures, but for what I saved I can get by. I love that it charges quick and easy. So far in regular computer use the battery has been great. I've gotten weeks of use. I love the texture and contour. It fits my hand really well and the buttons are a really pleasing soft click that gives it the feel of a more expensive mouse. I do wish that the two thumb buttons could be programmed to do what I wanted. They are preset functions that aren't that useful. If they were programable I would have given a full 5 stars, but I still would recommend the mouse for those on any Mac computer
Right click is incredibly easy to press. even if i relax my finger on the right click, it clicks. also scroll click isnt silent

I chose this mouse over the other options based on the claim that it was for large hands. I typically use a Logitech MX Master 2S Wireless Mouse on my desktop computer and this seemed to have similar dimensions. Unfortunately the curve height is an inch lower on this mouse. This has ended up positioning my wrist at a different angle. I am hoping I will adapt but I find myself accidently clicking the buttons on the side with my thumb by accident. I have found this becomes a huge issue when gaming. So far I have not found a way to disable these buttons the way I am able to on my other mouse when gaming.

Okay, so in an honest product review -- there are some great things about this mouse and some not-so-great things.I searched all over to find a home replacement for my MX-pro series that is left locked in my office. I have bigger hands and struggle with most standard mice. I also needed something rechargeable and wireless. I should note, I've only used this with the 2.4Ghz dongle and have not tried with my tablet.I really like the size of the mouse, though the ring-finger grip is a little awkward to get used to. The tracking and overall feel are good though, and the clicks are silent as advertised.I can't shake the feeling that the mouse is much too light weight -- but for a sub-$20 mouse, I'm happy with the purchase and would buy again. I prefer a weightier feel and a slightly larger lateral grip -- but again, for the price point it works well, seems well made, and works as advertised.
Bought to use with my laptop and it's awesome. Love the ergonomic shape that fits my hand without being uncomfortable. Takes a single click to wake it up, and it's ready to go.
deliverey time and quality is great. I've had it for a while now and can't think of any complaints.

The size is nice and the left and middle buttons are quiet. However, at it's highest resolution, it becomes unresponsive and jitters. I'd say that's not good for gaming, but that's not good for anything really. It's only $15 so not that big of a loss. I think I'm just going to stick to wired mice from now on.

I have had multiple other bluetooth mouses, and this is by far the worse. The shape/feel of it is nice, but no matter what device it is used on it lags like there is no tomorrow. No matter what settings I adjust nothing appears to make it better. It is usable but not for anything other than the bare minimum. I honestly don't suggest any to waste their money on this.

reviewTitle: Good mouse but doesn't work all the time
reviewDescription: When I used this mouse it worked really nicely and was quiet, BUT soon after (within the same day) it would randomly dissapear off of my screen. This kept happening and made using it impossible. I had to go back to using my old wired mouse until I can but a new one. Would not recommend this mouse only because of that issue.

It was working great when I first got it! After 2 months, the Bluetooth won't connect anymore. I'm not sure why. It stopped working all of a sudden. Before this, the connectivity was good and the response was really good.

It was nice while it lasted, which was all of 3 months.  Seems like it lost the ability to charge as when I turn the mouse off and back on I can get about 2 clicks from it before it disconnects again. Pretty disappointing. If they could send me a replacement id be happy.  These have a 1 year warranty. So I hope it will be quick and easy.

Not sure if mine was broken or this was by design, but the first few clicks of the scroll wheel are ignored after a few seconds of not using the wheel. I couldn't stand it after a while and had to get a different one. The bright side is it's inexpensive, rechargeable, and light

good for price, but not great for gaming. it only registers 3 inputs at once so if you have to you right button to aim down sites left top shoot and say crouch with m4 one of the commands will not work.

reviewTitle: Not the best but it is cheap.
reviewDescription: This mouse is definitely not ergonomic. In order to make it for comfortably in my hand, I keep having to turn the angle and then my finger doesn’t line up with the clicker. You can also see in the video that the scroll wheel is very loose and wiggles from side to side like it is broken. I’ve only had it for about one week.

reviewTitle: The mouse was too big for my hand
reviewDescription: This mouse was too big for my hand and was not comfortable.  I wanted a smaller mouse with basic capabilities and this one had advanced features (three-mode bluetooth)  that I did not need.  I returned it and got a refund.
Constantly loses Bluetooth connection. Constantly. Very frustrating

reviewTitle: I glued the thumb buttons in place.
reviewDescription: I went with the Pro Black version.  It is Bluetooth in that is has a USB dongle that it uses to help connect to your computer.  Seeing how computers these days have a very limited number of actual USB ports, a true Bluetooth connection to the computer would be most ideal.  This mouse is simply ok but works very well for what it costs.  I do believe that you will get plenty use out of it if you can tolerate a few things.First off, I am very happy with how quiet it is.  This is actually my favorite feature.Secondly it is a good size and feels ergonomically correct for my hands.It is simply designed having a right and left finger button along with a very nice scroll wheel between.  A very typical mouse design.  Typical is good.  It also comes with a DPI setting button and two additional buttons that seem to function mostly as forward, back, & exit buttons.  I didn't dig deep enough yet to see if they can be programmed for other uses.  These buttons are very easily pressed which became very irritating for me.  So irritating that I super glued them in place so I couldn't accidently press one or the other when picking it up and moving it around.With these buttons so easily pressed, it brings up another negative for me.  When picking the mouse up there was no avoiding pressing one or the other buttons.  Gluing the buttons in place completely made that annoyance go away making the picking up of the mouse easier because it allowed for leverage to pick up the slack of a slick surface of the mouse structure.  The plastic molding of the mouse is very slippery.  This is different from the top surface of the mouse which has a subtle rubber coating.  It is my opinion that the entire mouse should be coated in this subtle rubber as it would help with a good overall grip.  A good grip is something this mouse does not provide.

Im not okay with this mouse because its a huge pain to scroll. The scroll pad is pretty useless and barely moves the screen up and down- i have to scroll the wheel a billion times just to get it to move 1 cm sometimes. Other times it works.IT is incredibly annoying

reviewTitle: Connectivity features are great, but the battery will die on you quick
reviewDescription: Have had this mouse for a little over a month and a half now. It's overall great in many ways- the bluetooth switch button works well, and it has connected easily to everything I've attempted (multiple laptops, desktop). It feels very comfortable to use and the buttons are smooth. One thing that does suck is that the battery life suddenly dropped drastically a few weeks ago. I was only needing to charge maybe every other week, and now I need to charge it daily or it'll die on me mid-use. Definitely something to watch out for.

reviewTitle: Nice mouse but not USB C
reviewDescription: Mouse works goodBut charges via USB MiniI thought all USB plugs got standardized to USB C ?This is a real pain in the A$$I have to hunt down the box and cable to charge itI would avoid this mouse in the future

reviewTitle: battery drains faster than other inphics, movement not smooth
reviewDescription: i have another inphic that uses the wireless usb nub thing as the receiver instead of bluetooth, and the battery on that lasts MUCH longer than this one. that probably doesn't require as much power, so it's understandable, but over time this has proven to be pretty annoying. i've charged my other inphic maybe 2 or 3 times the whole time i've had it, and i've charged this one at least twice in as many months. i didn't need to charge it quite as often when i was using the usb nub option, which reinforces my suspicion about it being easier on the battery, but given how much beefier this mouse is than the other inphics, i feel like there's plenty of space here for a more substantial battery to compensate for thatalso, recently i've been having trouble with this mouse feeling like it's dragging on the pad. moving short distances for accuracy (highlighting small font text etc) has proven difficult because the mouse doesn't move as far as i'm expecting, and then jumps forward. it doesn't feel like lag, so i don't want to say there's something wrong with the signal, but i think there's something about the little stickers that are meant to make movements smooth that's going awry. in particular, one looks like it's peeling a little at the top (specifically the trapezoid one on the side).i don't game, but given the above problems, i wouldn't recommend this for it. maybe if you use the nub. not sure if that has more or less latency than bluetooth, but either way, the drag factor seems like it would be a problemthe shape is good, and i like inphic, but this mouse is a real headache when it comes to certain tasks and i wish the little stickers on the bottom were different. either physical pieces that can't peel off, or still stickers but applied perfectly with super glue–level adhesion

I read all the reviews before purchasing this mouse. I may have gotten a lemon for this mouse. I like all the features for the gaming, the comfort and connectivity. But my downfall for this mouse is the battery life. I have to charge it before playing every time. It will only last for that day. In which I might only get to play 2-4 hours a day. The next day, you bet I have to charge it up again before it will work. But once it gets a full charge, it does what I need it to do.
Bought a couple months ago and I charge it every weekend. I use it for 40hr work weeks on the computer. It recently started dying on me mid shift even after it’s fully charged.

I can force it to turn back on if I leave it plugged in directly and use it like that, but if I take it off the charger it will automatically stop working, no matter what I try. Overall, it's a nice mouse and I'm glad i got it over the normal walmart ones I've been getting the last 15+ years. That being said, there needs to be a way to tell which DPI setting you are in. The battery last more then long enough with being used as much as it is. Charges back up fast enough. Sleep mode it a pain at times, wish there was a way to turn it off if we dont want to use it but it's not bad enough to stop me from getting another in the future should I need it
It is incredibly light, but somehow didn’t work very well with my table top. Other mice have no issues

Bought this for the silent click, which it is for the left right but the side clicks are loud.Biggest problem is I cant get comfortable on this mouse. Average sized mans hand but left finger winds up on wheel not clicker

Works like other bluetooth mice, but the location of the forward/back button is so close to the thumb that you'll end up bumping the 'back' button while moving around the screen. I've hit it several times and lost my spot on a page, or game. For that reason, I wouldn't recommend. Everything else works great so far (2 months)

The price is good. The mouse connected easily and seems to work fine, but the sensitivity is very low. Even with mouse speed at maximum on my computer and the highest sensitivity setting on the mouse the sensitivity felt a little low for me. I didn't test the Bluetooth connection or battery life.

Just bought it and was looking forward to using it. It worked fine. No problems. Unfortunately, it didn't feel very ergonomic to me. Maybe it's just my hand but this didn't feel right.

reviewTitle: A generic mouse that meets generic expectations
reviewDescription: This mouse is mediocre but that was about what I expected for a $17 mouse.First, Maximum DPI setting on this mouse does not behave like I would expect a mouse at 1600 DPI to behave. It's on screen movement speed felt about equal to a logitech g series or a razer deathadder at a 600-800 DPI setting. I wouldn't be surprised if either the DPI is overstated or it's achieved by in mouse interpolation of a smaller DPI sensor (or both). In any case if you need a 1600 DPI mouse that acts like others on the market, buy a better mouse. While I knock the weird DPI of this mouse, it still feels higher than a $5-10 wired model.Glide of this mouse is rough, akin to other mice in the under $20 range (if you have ever used a public computer at a hotel/school/etc, that is the glide feel to this mouse)Ergonomics of the mice is pretty good. Much better than other mice at this price point. Most people would be happy with it (though it is a bit on the light side).For gaming, my entire use case for this mouse was for casual couch gaming (city/world building games). For those this is OK. If your going to use this mouse for competitive shooters or for competitive RTS games, spend the extra $20 and get a gaming mouse (you can get a great mouse for $40). The lack of tactile/sound feedback (left/right mouse button click is silent with little feedback) from this mouse (and the DPI issues from above) will make these games not a great experience (unless your use to using a $5 wired mice, the this may seem like a high end mouse).Long story short, it's an OK mouse for occasional use if you go into this thinking your getting a wireless version of a $10 mouse with decent ergonomics. If you think your going to get a $100 gaming mouse experience, your in for a bad time.Final note: don't use BT3.0 with this mouse if you can help it. Use BT5.0, the experience is way smoother.

reviewTitle: I wanted to love it, I really did.

But I find that instead of utilizing the indented thumb rest, I am holding my thumb along the bottom most edge of said indent. I think if they made a slum version of this it would be perfect. Oh BTW I have some of the very largest hands known to man, so I assure your “mostly-average” hands will suffer the same or worse fate.

the scroll takes a long time to respond. Communication with the receiver is easily influenced by any nearby device resulting in a slow movement of the pointer. My bluetooth connection did not work properly, a disappointment as I wanted to have an additional free port on my computer.
I was really excited thinking I found an aesthetic metal mouse. It’s a great mouse for sure, just note that it’s not metal

Good cheap mouse, connects multiple ways. The top buttons are quiet. Its is very good cheap mouse.For the bad the side buttons, the placement is right under the thumb and just holding the mouse feels like I'm going to inadvertently press them. The side buttons are supper clicky and loud. If the mouse did not have the side buttons it would be an improvement (and I like and use the buttons on the side). The length is a little short for me it is a longer mouse, I prefer a longer mouse. It is light and feels plasticky, but this is ok for the price is expected. So for a general use cheap mouse where you don't care about occasionally have the back button pressed then its ok.  If you want to play games I would pick a different one.

Comfortable to use but the there are Page Forward and Back buttons on the left side Ny your thumb. The back button is too easy to click accidentally.

reviewTitle: Faint, high screeching sound whenever you move the mouse?
reviewDescription: Battery life is pretty good, and the clicking is super silent, which is great (except for middle mouse clicks)!I came from a mouse with a really smooth bottom, so I was not used to this mouse dragging against the mouse mat more than the previous one, but I got used to it and gaming wasn't an issue.The one annoying thing that is a deal breaker for me is the fact that this mouse makes a very quiet but high screeching sound whenever you move it (for the duration that you are moving it). I don't think mice should make this sound. It's faint at first, but I realized that I heard some weird high pitched sound in my room at times, and I found out it was the mouse! It's annoying, since I like a really quiet environment.

Pros:  Clicking sound is softer than a normal click, so I don't have to worry about waking my kid up in the next room from clicking.  Design is attractive and comfortable.  Good connectivity utilizing the USB dongle.  I like the rechargeable battery feature vs. replacing batteries, but I can't speak to battery life yet.Cons:  I specifically bought this instead of other mice because I thought I wouldn't have to click it to wake it up.  You DO have to click it to wake it up, and you run the risk of clicking something you didn't want to.  I don't like that the forward thumb button is out of reach with normal hand placement, but I don't use it enough for that to be a real issue.

I love the mouse and I gamed with it, it’s comfy and silent but after 2 weeks the right click button started messing up  on me I have to click it 3 times for it to work or click hard. Other than that it’s nice.

It good for that price but it imponderable and you can't feel that mouse in your hand. As a person who spends more than 12 hours at the computer I can say that it better to collect money and buy logitech mouses (I used a one of G502 and it really good).

reviewTitle: Good general purpose, mid for gaming
reviewDescription: The mouse design is solid enough, and the wireless & Bluetooth make it handed excellently for general pc use, however the buttons wear out fast, and after only a few months I've begun to have issues where the buttons don't always input when they've been clicked.

reviewTitle: Ergonomic shape doesn't arc comfortably for my fingers, wider than expected
reviewDescription: It works and I can imagine for a lot of users the ergonomic shape is great.I had previously found portable laptop mice too small for my hand... So I went for full-size mouse. Unfortunately the length causes discomfort both for my fingers and for my wrist-- the two places that fatigue and strain muscles in hand. On the front end it, so it's actually painful at the joints between fingers and wrist requiring muscular exertion to try to compensate. That's because the the tallest part of the mouse's arc isn't fitting that joint area. It doesn't arc down enough for my fingers to gently rest. And on the back side of mouse, it's very uncomfortable for my wrist because of the lack of slope-down for the fingers, and the length, again, places the center of balance way off from comfortable.

reviewTitle: Quality of mouse has gotten cheaper
reviewDescription: The clicks are quiet which is great but the quality of the mouse has gone down. I ordered this mouse again after a few months because the first design was so well done I wanted another one as a spare. I received this one today and compared it the first one I ordered, and it's not the same. The one I got today looks much cheaper and looks like it'll malfunction quickly.

the thumb rest forces my thumb against the back button causing occasional accidental clicks. for smaller hands or slender digits this is probably a good mouse, no issues with connectivity and tracking

I haven't used this mouse more than a couple days so I can't give you a review on its durability or anything like that. I'll tell you that I plugged it in, charged it up, connected it to bluetooth and it worked like a charm.But.. the thing fits my hand awfully. I'm now about to purchase another mouse because it simply doesn't fit in my hand correctly. The way the "ergonomic" curves are built in the mouse make the mouse slip into or out of a good position to actually use the mouse buttons. along the side of the mouse. Also, sometimes its hard to grip the mouse and pick it up. The design makes it so it wants to fall out of your hand when you lift it.Maybe my hands are too big or something. I won't give it a fail rating but as of now its gonna collect dust somewhere as a back up mouse while I purchase one that fits better.

reviewTitle: Poor build quality and uncomfortable to handle
reviewDescription: Negatives:1. The bottom of this mouse is not flat so it wobbles from left to right when used on a hard surface. Every time I click the left mouse button it wobbles, which is extremely annoying and interferes with the accuracy of the clicks.2. The shape of the mouse is not comfortable to hold in the hand, it does not quiet match the contour of my hand and my right thumb is constantly touching the side buttons.Positives1. Left and right mouse buttons are near silent2. Has bluetooth and USB connection

reviewTitle: Feels and sounds nice, but laggy response
reviewDescription: This mouse feels comfortable in my hand. The sound of the soft/silent clicks is really nice. It’s just a little laggy with response time on both Bluetooth settings.I bought this for my MacBook Air since they no longer come with USB A ports. It connects quickly and easily. Again, there’s just a bit of lag sometimes. I’m not able to test the usb-connect/wireless connection, but I imagine it would have a much smoother response.

reviewTitle: Basically okay, but a few disappointments.
reviewDescription: I thought I'd like the ability to switch between Bluetooth and its included 2.4G wieless USB dongle, but I found the BT connection has noticeable lag and takes a few seconds to wake up after it's put itself to sleep (which it does far too quickly, IMO). The buttons are good, and the main buttons are very quiet (but not actually silent). I like the feel of the scroll wheel. It has no visible light emitted from under it, but it's clearly an optical mouse. Every now and then the mouse pointer jumps to random places on the screen, and that would be a MAJOR pain while gaming. Maybe this was just a quirk in my unit, but maybe it's related to the non-visible-light detector under the mouse. IDK.
La calidad de construcción podría ser un poco mejor.

reviewTitle: Byebye click click, functions for it’s price point
reviewDescription: Set up and comfort is great.  I game occasionally (mainly web surf) so I appreciate that this mouse is quite and functions as it should.  My scroll wheel is a bit loose and feel it should be more precise.  For the price I am not disappointed and would give this 5 stars if the scroll wheel was tighter or cleaned up.  I’m sure it’s just mine cause that’s the way it goes sometimes.  Yes I would purchase it again as I have put it through heavy use, only needing a single charge over a months use.

I've had this mouse for about 3ish months and it's giving out on me. I'm not sure if it's because it's just faulty or whatever but it doesn't work the same anymore. It worked perfectly when I first got it, but for the past month, it has been going on and off on me :/

To switch connections requires you to lift the mouse and push a button on the bottom of the mouse, not convenient when switching between multiple computers during the day. The Logitech M720 has got a better design for moving between machines.
Mouse works fine for bluetooth but the included wireless dongle does not work, its basically a useless piece of metal and plastic.

It's not wide enough so my ring finger doesn't fit where it's supposed to. I could deal with that because I didn't buy it for ergonomics, but my issue with it is that the mouse is so touchy and there is no precision. It's very difficult to click on something because the mouse will move the cursor while you're clicking, causing you to click on the wrong thing. This is after very delicately trying to get the cursor in the right place in the first place.

reviewTitle: Just don't like ergonomics and turning it on every time.
reviewDescription: Maybe it's just my personal preference, but I don't like the ergonomics. I have bigger hands and somehow it just doesn't fit my hand correctly. My 6 year old regular logitech mouse fits better but looks smaller. I also wish it had rubber where the thumb rests like my logitech. I know this mouse was only $15 which is why I gave it 3 stars instead of 2 or 1. Battery life seems good, but I don't like that I have to turn it off and on every time I use it.

The mouse feels good in my hand and the clicks are nice. The sleep mode kicks on a bit too quick for my liking. I have to recharge this once a month which is a huge step down from my old nonrechargable mouse which would last 6+. It is impossible to use the mouse while charging if you use the cable that comes with the mouse.

reviewTitle: Good mouse, bluetooth connection drops sometimes
reviewDescription: The mouse overall is very good. It's ergonomic and the two main buttons are silent. It was a little larger than my previous mouse but I got used to the size quickly. The buttons are silent, and the scroll wheel is also very nice. The only complaint I have is the bluetooth connection drops intermittently and mouse becomes nonresponsive for a few seconds. For the moment, I am just using the mouse with provided 2.4 GHz USB receiver, and USB connection has no issues at all.

I like how simple it is to connect the mouse, but my only problem with it is that the mouse can become unresponsive sometimes. For example, I'll be playing a game on PC and for a few seconds the mouse turns off for 2-3 seconds, but then comes right back on.This mouse isn't the best for gaming, but IF you're just looking to buy an affordable mouse then this will suffice.Lastly, I guess the cool thing about this mouse is that it has certain DPI modes.

Device look and size are great however the function is poor. The mouse constantly disconnected when using Bluetooth even while still in use. USB function won't work at all. So it is a paperweight now.

reviewTitle: Item stopped working after 2 months of use
reviewDescription: Item stopped working after the first recharge. I believe the toggle went bad, will try and contact manufacturer to obtain a new toggle. The mouse works in bluetooth mode.

It rarely (if ever) lost connection, it was easy enough to charge, and most of all, the clicking was quiet. I purchased this in February of 2022 and it died in October 2022. reviewTitle: Not like the MX Master but ok in a pinch
reviewDescription: This little mouse just wasn’t for me. The sleep mode was very annoying and it’s not as big as it looks. I don’t have fat mitten hands or sausage fingers, but I do have large hands and this mouse is just too small for me. I’m 6’4 so I’m a large guy and I need a big enough mouse for my size hands and this wasn’t it. Could be that I was coming from a Logitech MX Master to this as it was an emergency and I needed a mouse ASAP. I can see this potentially being a good travel mouse; however, you need to keep the charger close as it only lasted me a max of 12hrs (I work 6hr days-so two days for me). I need something that will hold a charge for much longer than that. It’s also so lightweight and thin that I felt it would break easily though I can’t confirm how durable it actually it is. This might be good in a pinch and for the price or if you have average sized hands; but long term, spend the extra money if you can and go for something of better quality. Again, it’s hard to compete with the MX Master and if that’s what you’re used to, I would pass on this guy and cough up the extra money to get another one

reviewTitle: ok, Battery does not last long
reviewDescription: I got this mouse because my old one was small, the scrolling started going all over the place and it wouldn't move smootly.  Turns out it was the table losing it's color, so this new mouse also moves crazy, but it's not the mouse's fault.  The scrolling still acts up, so not sure what the problem is, but have to scroll slowly for it to go up or down and not jittery.  But i do like the bigger feeling.  The buttons are responsive but i do miss the 5 DPI settings.  I work with 2 large screens and having the 5th setting helps minimize hand movement.  I've been working from home for a year now and my previous regular battery mouse lasts about half a year if not more with a set of batteries, but this mouse lasts about a week.  I'm in the middle of work and i lose the mouse.  For that alone, it gets 3 stars, because now i have to use the old mouse and have to keep swapping it out.  There's no indicator light to indicate time for recharge.  My regular battery mouse starts blinking to let me know it's about to die.  It was less than $20, but having to buy another one, makes me kick myself for not buying the one for $60 up front that may have been a better purchase.

It's decently quiet, which was my primary concern. But it goes into sleep mode way too quickly, and you have to click one of the buttons to wake it up- moving it around doesn't do the trick. I get that this is to conserve power, but at least give me an option to change how long it stays awake, or disable sleeping altogether. It may seem like a small complaint, but it really starts to get annoying over time.

For 6 months it did a reasonable job. A few issues with bluetooth connectivity, but other than that, it worked fine, but for the last few weeks, the buttons have been less responsive and as of today the left click no longer works. I use this mouse only periodically at work (office work), not every day nor all day, so I was surprised I didn't get even a year out of it. So it works fine but don't expect it to stand up to even mild abuse.

reviewTitle: Awkward in hand and surprisingly short battery life
reviewDescription: This mouse is awkward in my hand. I have fairly large hands and this mouse does not fit comfortably in it. The biggest problem is the placement of the two buttons on the inside left side of the mouse. They are too easy to hit and in general, are causing frustration.  I may pass this mouse on to someone else in my house and find another.The other issue is the battery life.  Fully charged and after a full day's use, I found I had to charge it by the 3rd morning.  So, yes, you can plug it in after every day and recharge it, but that seems inconvenient at best, and poor design at worst.

reviewTitle: Works no problem, but the design has a major flaw
reviewDescription: It has everything a rechargeable bluetooth mouse has to offer. I have no complaint. BTW the battery holds a long charge.The problem is, the right side of the mouse is slippery. When the mouse is used it does not always stay on the surface. We sometimes lift it up and re-position to somewhere we feel comfortable. And the slippery side makes this very difficult.. I have to use extra fingers to hold the mouse to prevent from dropping down.

reviewTitle: Good mouse for normal use, but gaming I won't recommend
reviewDescription: It's alright for normal use but for gaming for some reason I can't press the side forward button and right click at the same time, every other button combination can but it's just that specific combination that can't work

Let me start off by saying this mouse is really comfortable to use and the design looks nice. I like how versatile it is to use with bluetooth and the usb receiver.  I can use the mouse with my mac mini and use the bluetooth with my samsung galaxy tab s7 plus. My only complaint about this mouse is the scroll wheel. Scrolling through web pages is really slow and not as fast as some logitech mice I've used. Wish scrolling was a bit faster.

This mouse is okay. A bit small for my huge hand, a big sluggish in its responsivity, and for some reason the cursor is slow even with the sensitivity turned all the way up. But, that being said, it points and it clicks. Which is all I need it to do. If I were doing something such as gaming with it though, I'd be highly disappointed.

Seemed like a good mouse, but I didn't use it long enough to evaluate thoroughly. The 'forward & back' buttons protrude just a little, but constantly feeling them under the edge of my thumb was like... a pebble in my shoe... it actually hurt and was driving me crazy.

Although this mouse has two side buttons and one central top button, there is no programing to map these buttons to. Therefore, only the left and right buttons and wheel are functional. This is very sad considering I purchased this mouse because it did have the two side buttons - thinking they would function of something...Wrong!Further, the mouse is advertised as ergonomic and from the looks of the mouse you would think that it would be but the angles are horrible wrong...you would need to have fingers growing out of the side of your hand to be able to press the main left and right buttons while griping the mouse "ergonomic" design.  I'm really surprised how bad this design is. The mouse does function well in Bluetooth or wireless mode but there is the issue about the buttons and the fit in your hand. I was surprised to see that the mouse is powered by an internal not changeable battery therefore overall life may depend on the longevity of the internal battery.

reviewTitle: Good mouse, but too heavy for my hand.
reviewDescription: Good mouse, but too heavy for my hand, for that reason won't be maybe too good for games and makes my wrist hurt while tooo much use.

reviewTitle: Tried two and they just won't work on all surfaces.
reviewDescription: Tried two and they just won't work on all surfaces.  I have mike from Tecknet, Logitech and other brands which had no issue working on any surface but this thing bounces around like crazy unless it is on a solid surface.  I don't think I have had a mouse act like that since back in the old days when we have optical mice with the red light and a USB plug.  I mean it works fine, takes a long time to charge and doesn't last that long.  So it is mediocre.  But if you sit a desk all day with a real mouse pad, it might work just fine.  That isn't my work and my other $12-$15 dollar mice work just fine in my use situation.  I just like trying out new devices and these didn't make the cut.

it has a couple of buttons that are placed so that you can't help but to activate them which causes havoc with the normal functions. I tried to find a way to disable them online but no luck. The instructions were no help at all.

So, this device does work in BT 3.0 mode on Windows XP.  However, whenever I try to pair the device with the machine, it requires a passcode from the device.  This bluetooth passcode is not anywhere listed on the device, manual, website, and even emailed support who had no idea what I was talking about.  So, after trying out random codes, I found that 0000 worked.  So, if you get the same issue, try 3, 4, 5 or 6 zeroes as a device code when pairing.Also, this device takes A LONG time to wake up.  Depending upon how long it has not been used, it may take longer to "warm up."  I would suggest manually powering off, powering it back on, and doing several left clicks and right clicks.  For me, on average, takes about 3 rounds of left click-right click before it comes back to life.-1 star for support, -1 star for product flaws.  Additionally, I was under the impression that this device could be used as a wired in mouse when connect to a USB port from the computer:  this does not appear to be the case.  You'll be hard pressed, as a Windows XP user, to find a late technology bluetooth mouse that works for the system that can also be recharged via USB port.

I use this on my Linux Pop Os laptop and it only needed to be hooked up once. When ever I start the PC I just giggle the mouse and it wakes up and goes to work. Battery life is a bit short. Maybe a day or two. But all and all not bad for a low price blue tooth mouse.

reviewTitle: Affordable Trucker Friendly Mouse But Not For Gaming
reviewDescription: I was looking for a affordable Bluetooth wireless mouse to use with my Chromebook and that would be trucker tough this one fit the bill of what I was looking for although I do have my complaints with it. When in Bluetooth mode it falls asleep way too quickly making it a pain in the butt to get re-paired with my Chromebook I'm very disappointed that in a world of type c connectors this one still uses micro USB I find that the sensitivity even in its lowest setting is a little overkill if not used on a smooth surface such as a table or the back of a clipboard in my case since this is an optical laser mouse and doesn't have "use anywhere" capabilities. I have quite large hands and do find this mouse comfortable to use and the quiet clickers are a welcome feature. Due to this mouse's inconsistent responsiveness in any mode because of its CPI I don't recommend this as a gaming mouse it's temperamental enough just being used as an office mouse.

reviewTitle: OK Mouse but definitely not on a Mac
reviewDescription: This mouse has great ergonomics and is comfortable to use. It works okay for everyday computing.The problem is that I bought it to use on a Mac and it does not work at the login screen at all. You have to use the keyboard to get into the computer before you can use this mouse. I also find that it is annoying to wake it from sleep. Every time you don't move it for so long it goes into sleep mode and you have to click the buttons and move it around to get the mouse to wake up. Sometimes you have to move it around the screen even while you have been using it to get it to work again. The one I received did not come with a usb connector that usually comes with wireless mouses and I could not get the wifi feature working. I tried out the mouse in Bluetooth 4.0 and 5.0 and both work.

reviewTitle: Takes a long time to wake up from sleep mode
reviewDescription: UPDATE: Changing to 3 stars it takes way to long to wake up.  If I walk for away it takes almost a minute to wake up and that is just to long to use for work.  I will keep it as aback up mouse only...Original Review: It’s a lot lighter than it looks but it feels OK in the hand it was very easy to sync via Bluetooth to my windows 10 computer my only complaint is it takes a long time to wake up from sleep mode other than that it works great…. I’ve been using it two days straight 10-12 hours a day, I haven’t had to recharge the battery yet.

reviewTitle: Almost perfect - until it goes to sleep after a few seconds of innactivity.
reviewDescription: Very comfortable mouse, almost no input lag on BT5.0 - works wired too!  It's almost perfect, but the fact that the sensor goes to sleep after only 2-3 seconds of inactivity makes it useless for gaming. It does wake up quickly from sleep - but that little pause before movement can really throw off your shot.Hopefully inphic can release a firmware update to fix this - then it would be perfect.

I purchased this mouse to replace my old Logitech mouse whose right-click button was beginning to fail.The mouse connected to my computer just fine, and has been running on a single charge for over 2 weeks now.The performance is good, the silent clicking is nice.The mouse is a solid performer, and has enough buttons to be useful for gaming purposes. Just be careful what you map to those side buttons (see below).What I cannot abide however are 2 things which drops this down the rating scale.1. The shape of the mouse and placement of the side buttons are such that I find it nearly impossible to lift the mouse and reposition it without clicking on the side buttons.2. Most egregious however is the sleep mode. If you stop using the mouse for 5 minutes, it goes to sleep to conserve power. That would be fine if it recovered from sleep more quickly.  The delay is at least 2 seconds from the time you CLICK a button to wake it up.  It does NOT even wake up when it is moved.  I wish there were a way to turn off this "feature" and pay the penalty on the charge rate.Overall, I would not purchase this, or any similar mouse that "features" an automatic "sleep mode" which you cannot disable. I do not think the problem is with this manufacturer, nor this mouse in particular - it seems to be pretty standard behavior (having read more about the sleeping mice since it arrived) for rechargeable mice.  Including the long "wake" delay.
